page.title: 03ATTITUDES ABOUT TERLING
page.content: The general concensus of opinion is that Terling is a very desirable village, in which to live. It is very picturesque and well preserved and there is a full social life for those who wish to take part in it, and a good community spirit. The teenagers might wish for more activities, though there is a Youth Club which though threatened with closure has been reprieved. There is no vandalism or discipline problem since village children seem gentler than town children. Most people would like to see a better Public Transport service, though most have cars. Our local historian remembers frequent buses to Chelmsford, also her school_days here in the 2nd World War, which were stricter,though she felt life was more fun, with a Working Men's Club putting on something different every night.
